page.title: 01INTRO Essex/Cambs Border
page.content: The area covers a small part of{ {Chrishall} village, Chrishall Grange and Ickleton Grange. It is situated at the NE end of the Chilterns. The Southern end is heavy boulder clay on the high ground of the Essex/Cambs border and land levels fall to chalk. 90% of the area is{open farmland. Over the whole area there is little population. Most people are local or live here by choice - for its environ- ment, peacefulness but reasonable access to the two Cambridge-London railway lines and the M11. The expansion of {Stansted Airport}adds a new dimension but threatens the conservation policies of the local planning authority. Despite the attractive {open rolling countryside} there is little tourist visiting. Over production of cereals may lead to a change of crops and landscape.
